main.name: Alvin Kingman Gao
main.description: I recently completed my SDE internship at Amazon where I worked on the Personalization eBooks team. I used Java to create the logic that generates the recommenders on various storefronts
main.bio: During my first job as an instructor, I learned that I really enjoyed mentoring and seeing others succeed. I believe in lifelong learning and always seek advice from my own mentors as well as encouraging my peers do the same. As a developer, I enjoy working with others to solve problems as I believe effective communication among peers leads to practical and elegant solutions.
main.bio2: Outside of coding, I spend a lot of my time playing competitive ultimate frisbee. I have captained and coached my college team and I have also played in the club division. I also made the practice team for a semi-professional team in LA.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelors of Science in Computer Science and Engineering
education.description: As a Computer Science and Engineering major at UCI, I ended up taking more math, physics, and circuits classes than a normal Computer Science major. By taking classes with such breadth, I discovered that I had the most interest in software development. I thoroughly enjoyed taking classes in engineering ethics, data structures, algorithms, systems, and compilers.

positions.title: Software Development Engineer Intern
positions.description: I worked on the Personalization eBooks team where I used Java create the logic that generates recommenders on various storefronts such as amazon.com/ebooks, kindle, and fire tablets. I specifically worked on creating the "Inspired by your Browsing History in Genre" recommender which recommends books based on the customer's recent browsing in a genre. This recommender is "Personalized" as the recommender is specific to each customer.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: I led a team of 4 interns to maintain and update one of the internal web apps. I also worked on the back-end API when it was blocking front-end development. This includes creating migration scripts, new GraphQL types and mutations, and hooks. My most significant work has been improving the usability of the front-end application. For example, I implemented GraphQL Pagination improving latency, implemented automatic email and SMS confirmations decreasing tedious tasks, and built the counseling management feature for more efficient scheduling of meetings.

positions.title: Software Developer Intern
positions.description: This was my first experience working with code outside of coursework from school. I started off learning Javascript (ES6), React, and GraphQL, and tackling bug fixes in front-end web applications. As I grew more comfortable with the codebase, I added features such as direct text and emails using Twilio API, and refactored one of the web apps to reduce technical debt and improve readibility.

positions.title: Instructor
positions.description: I was an instructor for summer camp and afterschool supplementary courses where I taught courses geared for kids in middle school and high school. The courses I taught include: Python 1, Computer Olympiad, Physics: Mechanics, Math Olympiad, and Accelerated Math.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
